Subject: LSAT Analytical Reasoning

Background: 
The LSAT (Law School Admission Test) is a standardized test used for admission to law schools in the United States and Canada. The exam consists of several sections, including Analytical Reasoning (also known as Logic Games) which assesses a candidate's ability to understand and analyze relationships between entities.
